title: Everglades National Park: Parks as Classrooms
body: Parks as Classrooms        Curriculum Materials Bring the Everglades into your classroom. Teachers, rangers, and other educators have helped develop our library of curriculum-based activities about water, wildlife, the environment and more.   All Curriculum Materials   "Don't Let it Loose" Curriculum    Learn how invasive species are impacting native ones. Learn More     Field Trips Give students a hands-on experience in Everglades National Park. Curriculum-based ranger-led programs are available for 4th-6th grades.   Find suggestions for leading your own group or requesting a special group program.  All Field Trips   Ranger / teacher led field trips    Rangers and teachers team-teach in the park. Learn More     Materials to Loan Borrow a small library of DVDs and CDs to use in your classroom. Learn about allligators, fire, birds, coral reefs, Everglades habitats, and more.  All Materials to Loan   Everglades Mountains & Valleys    Video series introduces students to the park habitats. Learn More     Traveling Trunks Teachers can pick up a trunk full of activities and a classroom set of books for teaching 3rd-5th grade students about the Miccosukee Indian culture. All Traveling Trunks   Traveling Trunks     Learn about the local Miccosukee Indian culture Learn More     Guest Speakers Request a park ranger to attend your next career day, classroom, or community event to bring an Everglades experience to you.  All Guest Speakers   Rangers in the Classroom    Rangers go out to schools and the community Learn More
